marketNews.title: US Labor Absorption Exceeds Expectations, Rupiah Under Pressure
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) recorded nonfarm payroll growth of 254,000 in September 2024, higher than the 12-month average growth of 203,000. This realization significantly exceeded economists' expectations of 140,000 based on a Reuters survey and marked the strongest growth since March 2024. The NFP growth in September 2024 was driven by the food services and drinking places, health care and social assistance, and construction sectors. This achievement caused the unemployment rate for September 2024 to drop to 4.1%, lower than the Reuters survey and the August 2024 realization of 4.2%. Furthermore, BLS also revised upward NFP for July 2024 to 144,000 (+61.8%) and August 2024 to 159,000 (+12%), both increased by 72,000 from the previous report. In response to this data release, market expectations for the Fed's interest rate cut until the end of the year decreased from 75 bps (target rate: 4-4.25%) last week to 50 bps (target rate: 4.25-4.5%) as of Monday (7/10), based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool. The US Dollar Index (DXY) strengthened by +0.52% to 102.5 and the 10-year US Treasury yield rose +20 bps to 4%. Meanwhile, the US stock market reacted positively with the S&P 500 closing up +0.9%, Dow Jones +0.76%, and Nasdaq +1.22% on Friday (4/10) local time as anxiety over a hard landing subsided. Key Takeaway: For Indonesia, this development provides negative sentiment towards the Rupiah exchange rate and government bonds. The Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar weakened by -1.26% to 15,680 in today's trading (7/10), while the 10-year government bond yield rose +8 bps to 6.73%. The prospect of fewer interest rate cuts by the Fed potentially narrows the room for BI to cut rates further. Based on the Bloomberg consensus as of October 7, 2024, BI is still expected to cut interest rates by a minimum of 25 bps until the end of 2024 and a minimum of 2x25 bps in 2025.

marketNews.title: Vietnam Records Strong GDP Growth Despite Typhoon Yagi Disruptions
marketNews.content: Vietnam recorded GDP growth of +7.4% YoY in Q3 24 (vs. 2Q24: +6.93% YoY; 3Q23: +7.09% YoY), the highest in the last 2 years. This achievement significantly surpassed the Bloomberg consensus expectation of +6.1% YoY despite the Vietnamese manufacturing sector contracting in September 2024 due to Typhoon Yagi. Exports in 3Q24 increased by +15.8% YoY and became the driver of growth.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Plans US$145 Million Divestment and US$31 Million Buyback
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama announced a plan for the divestment of two steam power plants (PLTU). The transaction plan is divided into two parts: (i) the sale of all shares along with the transfer of all receivables owned by the company in PT Gorontalo Listrik Perdana, and (ii) the sale of all shares owned by the subsidiary, PT Toba Bara Energi, in PT Minahasa Cahaya Lestari. The total value of the planned transaction reaches 144.8 million US dollars or equivalent to approximately 2.2 trillion rupiah, with PT Kalibiru Sulawesi Abadi as the purchasing party. In addition, TOBA also announced a plan for a buyback of 816 million shares or 10% of the total issued and paid-up capital. The total allocated funds for the buyback reach 30.8 million US dollars or equivalent to 474.5 billion rupiah. Both plans will seek approval at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) to be held on November 14, 2024.

tickerNews.title: FILM Plans Private Placement for Acquisition of NETV and Business Expansion
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment plans to conduct a capital increase without pre-emptive rights (PMTHMETD) or private placement through the issuance of a maximum of 951,121,700 new shares, equivalent to 10% of the Company's issued and paid-up capital. The exercise price is set at 3,891 rupiah per share, potentially raising funds up to approximately 3.7 trillion rupiah. Around 1.65 trillion rupiah from these funds will be used to acquire Net Visi Media (NETV). Meanwhile, the remaining funds will be used for FILM group business development and potential expansion. FILM will seek approval for this corporate action at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) to be held on October 8, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Caraka Reksa Optima Sells 20 Million PTRO Shares, Reducing Ownership Stake
tickerNews.content: One of Petrosea's majority shareholders, PT Caraka Reksa Optima, sold 20 million PTRO shares. This transaction was only recorded in the KSEI data as of September 30, 2024, so the transaction value is unknown. After this transaction, PT Caraka Reksa Optima's ownership in PTRO decreased from 36.15% to 34.17%.

tickerNews.title: LABA Inks Cooperation with ECGO to Supply Electric Motorcycle Batteries, Targets Significant Sales Growth
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Green Power Group, William Ong, stated that his party has signed a cooperation agreement with PT Green City Traffic (ECGO) to supply electric motorcycle batteries. William said that as of now, LABA has recorded sales of 9,000 units to ECGO and targets 31,000 units by the end of this year, before significantly increasing to 600,000 units next year.

tickerNews.title: BJTM Plans to Take Over BEKS, Becoming New Controller, Aims for Bank Business Group Formation
tickerNews.content: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur announced a plan to acquire 476 million shares and become the prospective new controller of Bank Pembangunan Daerah Banten (BEKS). The total transaction value and settlement time have not yet been announced. After becoming the controller of BEKS, BJTM will conduct a mandatory tender offer with an exercise price set at the highest daily trading price on the IDX during the last 90 days (July 6, 2024 - October 3, 2024). The objective of the acquisition plan is the formation of a Bank Business Group (KUB) in order to realize the strengthening of the structure, resilience, and competitiveness of the national banking industry.

tickerNews.title: TAMU Sells AWB Vessel to Pertamina Trans Kontinental for Debt Settlement, Restructures Credit with BMRI
tickerNews.content: Pelayaran Tamarin Samudra sold 1 unit of an Accommodation Work Barge (AWB) vessel named Petroleum Superior to PT Pertamina Trans Kontinental. The total transaction value reached approximately 13.8 million US dollars or equivalent to approximately 214 billion rupiah and is intended to partially repay the company's obligations. In a separate transaction, TAMU has signed a credit restructuring agreement with Bank Mandiri (BMRI) which remains effective until December 2026, by altering the amount of principal and interest payments each month.

tickerNews.title: ADES Controller Reduces Stake by Selling 1 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Akasha Wira International, Water Partners Bottling SA, sold 1,000,000 ADES shares at an average price of 9,000 rupiah per share on October 3, 2024. The total transaction value reached 9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Water Partners Bottling SA's ownership in ADES decreased from 91.52% to 91.35%.

tickerNews.title: RIGS Acquires Tug Boat Asset and Plans to Expand Business into Time/Voyage Charter Services
tickerNews.content: Rig Tenders Indonesia (RIGS) through its subsidiary, PT Batuah Abadi Lines, procured an asset worth 10 billion rupiah in the form of the Tug Boat PEC 2416, purchased from PT Dok Pendingin. In separate information, RIGS plans to expand its business activities to include ship leasing services with rates calculated on a daily basis (time charter) and/or tonnage/distance basis. This plan will be discussed at the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPST) to be held on November 13, 2024.

tickerNews.title: FX and Sovereign Bond Market Reaction Following Strong US Jobs Data
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia revealed that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves position at the end of September 2024 reached 149.9 billion US dollars, down from the August 2024 level of 150 billion US dollars. The decline in foreign exchange reserves was influenced by the government's external debt payments. The foreign exchange reserves position at the end of September 2024 is equivalent to financing 6.6 months of imports or 6.4 months of imports and government debt payments.

tickerNews.title: National Investment Fund Discussion Continues Under Prabowo-Gibran Camp
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the National Young Entrepreneurs Volunteers (Repnas), Anggawira, stated that the idea of forming a National Investment Fund (DIN) has entered the discussion of the Prabowo-Gibran team. Anggawira said that the DIN aims to manage state investments for strategic projects and will resemble Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund (PIF) or Singapore's Temasek.

tickerNews.title: OJK Urges Caution in Offering BNPL Services to Youth Amid Over-Indebtedness Concerns
tickerNews.content: The Head of Supervision of Financial Services Sector Behavior, Education, and Consumer Protection at OJK, Friderica Widyasari Dewi, stated that banking and financing companies should be more cautious in offering Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) services to young people. Frederica mentioned that the phenomenon of over-indebtedness among the younger generation is a global concern.

tickerNews.title: Gaikindo Considers Revising 2024 New Car Sales Target Due to Significant Decline in Public Purchasing Power
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the First Association of the Indonesian Automotive Industries (Gaikindo), Jongkie Sugiarto, said that they might revise the 2024 new car sales projection set at 1.1 million units. Jongkie assessed that public purchasing power has significantly decreased, directly impacting the slowdown in vehicle purchases. Jongkie stated that there has been a slight increase in the second semester, but the figure is still not significant.
